[{'created': '2021-12-09 08:39:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add retry when executing OF commands if "InvalidDatapath"

When using the OF API (currently Neutron only uses native
implementation via "os-ken" librarr), retry the command in case of
"InvalidDatapath" exception.

As commented in the related bug, some operations could restart the
OF controller (set the OF procols, set the bridge fail mode). During
the controller restart, a command can return a "InvalidDatapath"
exception.

'}]
commit_message:
Add retry when executing OF commands if "InvalidDatapath"

When using the OF API (currently Neutron only uses native
implementation via "os-ken" librarr), retry the command in case of
"InvalidDatapath" exception.

As commented in the related bug, some operations could restart the
OF controller (set the OF procols, set the bridge fail mode). During
the controller restart, a command can return a "InvalidDatapath"
exception.

Closes-Bug: #1944201
Change-Id: Ia8d202f8a38362272e9519c1cbd9d6ba9359e0a1
(cherry picked from commit 57629dc05122b01a9ba76606b8d75cce9da40776)
(cherry picked from commit e471a40a418dc743fb533fedfe69cff356859da5)

When using the OF API (currently Neutron only uses native
implementation via "os-ken" librarr), retry the command in case of
"InvalidDatapath" exception.

OF controller (set the OF procols, set the bridge fail mode). During
the controller restart, a command can return a "InvalidDatapath"
exception.

commit_message:
Add retry when executing OF commands if "InvalidDatapath"

When using the OF API (currently Neutron only uses native
implementation via "os-ken" librarr), retry the command in case of
"InvalidDatapath" exception.

As commented in the related bug, some operations could restart the
OF controller (set the OF procols, set the bridge fail mode). During
the controller restart, a command can return a "InvalidDatapath"
exception.

Closes-Bug: #1944201
Change-Id: Ia8d202f8a38362272e9519c1cbd9d6ba9359e0a1
(cherry picked from commit 57629dc05122b01a9ba76606b8d75cce9da40776)
(cherry picked from commit e471a40a418dc743fb533fedfe69cff356859da5)

commit_message:
Ensure nvme-cli is present in nova-compute images

The nvme-cli package is required to get the nvme command executed by
os-brick, which is used by nova-compute.

We don't need to explicitely install it for centos binary images, as it
is required by os-brick which is required by openstack-nova-common, but
all other types of images were missing it.

Change-Id: I754939da7636c57d2a8d5b83debb5d8a58e38432
Closes-Bug: #1953509
(cherry picked from commit 30eddf72f6d5380bb6078481581e47b0eec84982)

commit_message:
Drop Mesos code

The coe mesos has not been maitenaned for quite some
time and hasn't got much attetion from the community
in general. As discussed in the mailing list [1] we
are dropping for now.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-December/026230.html

Change-Id: Ie7de9a37bfad6214f52d0605409e74d62a51df47

commit_message:
Burn-in: Add options for named log files

In order to ease logging of the various burn-in steps, this patch
proposes options to define the outpout files for all burn-in steps:
{'agent_burnin_cpu', 'agent_burnin_vm', 'agent_burnin_fio_network',
'agent_burnin_fio_disk'}_outputfile  via a node's driver-info.

Story: #2007523
Task: #44102

Change-Id: I327cae5949d38e738d3c535487b3795d00ad8f1e

commit_message:
[train-only] Remove advanced-virt repo references

The advanced virt repository is no longer required to be
present on the undercloud or overcloud. Libvirt is now
fully containerised.

Related-Bug: rhbz#2027787

Change-Id: Ia856ddf43896f288a4bc9900c4eacdf10185e989

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I41155224878e8e63bf5a2bba548203d265b794b5

commit_message:
Instruct qemu-img to write image zeros to disk.

Doing this will cause it not to zero out the entire
block device which can be very costly on a slow HDD.

Story: 2009227
Task: 43315

Change-Id: I62ba2afc037d9844387e6b0984fe5008779d95d2

This definitely makes sense for update (which is also create).  But for show and delete, suppose that an operator's workflow for deleting a user from their cloud is: (1) remove them from keystone so they aren't authorized to do anything anymore, and then (2) go to each service and remove quotas.  The operator won't be able to see if there are any quotas for that project and won't be able to delete them if there are.  So these would just accumulate in the database, which doesn't seem to be ideal."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-07-16 16:08:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Thanks Brian for the review.

> Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1
> 
> This definitely makes sense for update (which is also create).  But for show and delete, suppose that an operator's workflow for deleting a user from their cloud is: (1) remove them from keystone so they aren't authorized to do anything anymore, and then (2) go to each service and remove quotas.  The operator won't be able to see if there are any quotas for that project and won't be able to delete them if there are.  So these would just accumulate in the database, which doesn't seem to be ideal.

The delete problem is fixed by the followup patch[1] which can remove quota records with invalid project id (removed recently or exists before this change). I separated both patches because of a pep8 failure which is blocking this patch for a long time, this change is important without that too so hence split it up.
The problem with the show command is it shows records for non-existent project ids which is really confusing. It is a double ended problem but i feel it's better to not show information rather than showing wrong information. Also if an operator removes a project from keystone, they don't need to show it and can directly remove its quota records via the cinder-manage command added in the followup patch.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/801048/"}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2021-07-16 16:33:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-05 11:19:53.000000000', 'message': "Add project validation in quotas

Currently when we try to perform any quota operation on a
non-existent project, cinder doesn't error out as cinder
doesn't validate the project id from keystone if it is a
valid project or not.

This patch adds the project validation so any quota operation
(update, show, defaults, delete) will error out with 404 if the
project id is non-existent in keystone database.

Closes-Bug: #1307491
Change-Id: Ie09028279bd399772ada72411de96ff72626224c
"}, {'created': '2021-04-06 10:24:01.000000000', 'message': "Add project validation in quotas

Currently when we try to perform any quota operation on a
non-existent project, cinder doesn't error out as cinder
doesn't validate the project id from keystone if it is a
valid project or not.

This patch adds the project validation so any quota operation
(update, show, defaults, delete) will error out with 404 if the
project id is non-existent in keystone database.
It also adds a cinder-manage quota utility command to remove
any quota records with an invalid project ID created prior to
this change.

Closes-Bug: #1307491
Change-Id: Ie09028279bd399772ada72411de96ff72626224c
"}, {'created': '2021-04-06 10:34:27.000000000', 'message': "Add project validation in quotas

Currently when we try to perform any quota operation on a
non-existent project, cinder doesn't error out as cinder
doesn't validate the project id from keystone if it is a
valid project or not.

This patch adds the project validation so any quota operation
(update, show, defaults, delete) will error out with 404 if the
project id is non-existent in keystone database.
It also adds a cinder-manage quota utility command to remove
any quota records with an invalid project ID created prior to
this change.

Closes-Bug: #1307491
Change-Id: Ie09028279bd399772ada72411de96ff72626224c

commit_message:
Add project validation in quotas

Currently when we try to perform any quota operation on a
non-existent project, cinder doesn't error out as cinder
doesn't validate the project id from keystone if it is a
valid project or not.

This patch adds the project validation so any quota operation
(update, show, defaults, delete) will error out with 404 if the
project id is non-existent in keystone database.

Closes-Bug: #1307491
Closes-Bug: #1620511
Closes-Bug: #1620512
Change-Id: Ie09028279bd399772ada72411de96ff72626224c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-09 09:37:59.000000000', 'message': "Always execute nova_api_ensure_default_cell

The cells initialization container nova_api_ensure_default_cell is not
executed then database_connection isn't updated in cell_mappings table.

Since we cannot know if database_connection is being updated or not,

commit_message:
Always execute nova_api_ensure_default_cell

The cells initialization container nova_api_ensure_default_cell is not
executed then database_connection isn't updated in cell_mappings table.

Since we cannot know if database_connection is being updated or not,
make nova_api_ensure_default_cell executed always.

Change-Id: I446276050107da1deb4caa9a600201b73136c919
Related: rhbz#2030191
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-07 12:25:18.000000000', 'message': 'Use intermediate chain as ca-cert

To pass CA check we actually need chain or root certificate, but not
just intermediate.

In addition to that this patch disables SSL verification when connecting
to localhost or through socket.

Change-Id: I556ae69c33ab9cc984d7c01868403be49faa0dbc
'}, {'created': '2021-12-07 16:19:07.000000000', 'message': 'Use intermediate chain as ca-cert

To pass CA check we actually need chain or root certificate, but not
just intermediate.

In addition to that this patch disables SSL verification when connecting
to localhost or through socket.

Change-Id: I556ae69c33ab9cc984d7c01868403be49faa0dbc
'}, {'created': '2021-12-08 13:34:38.000000000', 'message': "Do not verify certificate for local connects

We don't issue certififcate for localhost, and mysqlclient acts as
a localhost connection while connecting thorugh socket as well.
While issuing cert for localhost may lead to unpredictable results
we just avoid verifying certificate when connecting locally.

Change-Id: I556ae69c33ab9cc984d7c01868403be49faa0dbc
"}]
commit_message:
Do not verify certificate for local connects

We don't issue certififcate for localhost, and mysqlclient acts as
a localhost connection while connecting thorugh socket as well.
While issuing cert for localhost may lead to unpredictable results
we just avoid verifying certificate when connecting locally.

Change-Id: I556ae69c33ab9cc984d7c01868403be49faa0dbc

commit_message:
Burn-in: Add SMART self test to disk burn-in

Add the option to run a SMART self test right after
the disk burn-in. The disk burn-in step will fail if
the SMART test on any of the disk fails.

Story: #2007523
Task: #43383

Change-Id: I1312d5b71bedd044581a136af0b4c43769d21877

commit_message:
Ensure a recent version of pip is installed

commit caa8675adcc839909ff9290daa7a502fe89db291
switched to use ensure_pip_virtualenv_command command.

This review uses the same task as [1] in image builds
to ensure that a recent version of pip is installed
before installing from upper constraints.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/src/branch/master/roles/oooci-build-images/tasks/pre.yaml#L59
Closes-Bug: #1953617
Change-Id: I35837c6dc22aeb7ac43c37d29d22742a8378cdaf

commit_message:
New featureset: 064 for custom network

We are creating this new featureset064 that will deploy overcloud with
custom network + custom overcloud name + IPA integration.
(fs064 =  fs039 + custom overcloud network + custom overcloud name)

We intend to run this new featureset on wallaby+ to test the new
network-data-v2 work.

testproject: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/31954

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/812369
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/818529
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/818518

Change-Id: If27e9d8f32ba72400f425783a1e0c0ed12c6df65

commit_message:
[murano] Transition Ussuri to EM

This transition the ussuri branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I9924e9896396703981131582370fe296a8f8789e

commit_message:
Set default value of IronicDefaultBootMode to uefi

Now that OVB explicitly sets the boot mode based on discovered image
properties, the default can safely be set to 'uefi' which is more
appropriate for bare-metal environments.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/+/810332
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I32f9dc916959d8a283beab247d548379cd2b2981
(cherry picked from commit 9d6f2413113f5721d0447fa46c382fa3f9eb9be3)

[{'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2021-10-04 15:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2021-10-04 15:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2021-10-04 15:59:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-10-04 16:23:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

pretty sure a custom role-data.yaml is also needed.
While the doc[1] doesn't point it, there's a need to get the mapping between role and networks.

For instance, in the role-data.yaml, there's the "networks" dict, where you list the network.name and the relevant subnet you want to use, such as:

- name: Compute
  description: |
    Basic Compute Node role
  CountDefault: 1
  tags:
    - compute
    - external_bridge
  networks:
    InternalApiCloud0:
      subnet: internal_api_cloud_0_subnet
    TenantCloud0:
      subnet: tenant_cloud_0_subnet
    StorageCloud0:
      subnet: storage_cloud_0_subnet

Pretty sure something like that will be needed at some point.


[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/custom_networks.html'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-10-04 18:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Replying here as Sandeep is |out on IRC.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-10-04 19:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Also node topology must be updated, https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/config/nodes/3ctlr_1comp.yml#L43-L55 (and all the other node topology files ...)

Or if we can pass a custom barametal deployment definition yaml file, instead of using the node topology stuff.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-10-05 06:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add templates for custom network ci job

We are creating a new featureset064 that will deploy overcloud with
custom network + custom overcloud name + IPA integration.

With this patch, Adding tht templates that we will use in fs064 for
overcloud deployment.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/818529
Change-Id: I5119a2c0103868fd481b57b890947b2881b86845

commit_message:
Improve Router callback system's publish events

When I writing 'ndp_proxy' service plugin, I found I couldn't get enough
informations about router from the callback system (Such as: the origin
request body of user send). So, for write service plugin that related
router plugin more concisely I commit this patch.

This patch proposal two changes about router callback publish events:
1. Add 'request_body' parameter to some event's payload
2. add 'BEFORE_UPDATE' event for router gateway

Related-bug: #1877301
Change-Id: I5f6a4e6f0b7c5feb794ddb7efbd07d01bad91af8

commit_message:
init_host should be called before RPC consumer is created

This change adds a new hook to Manager class called init_host_with_rpc()
to allow services like scheduler to do something once RPC is ready.

Copied from cinder https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/65fa80c361f71158cc492dfc520dc4a63ccfa419
and https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/60c563f72d2d6d008fca03f0a058941f3807e1a8

Change-Id: Iac6507a6e395c55f0fec453650009f08c2bb6563
Closes-Bug: #1271568
(cherry picked from commit 0339802a5d0801cda19c464a87853b60982ae011)
(cherry picked from commit 887c4bf4c041cfaafaf1c47edb9262574bbb959a)
(cherry picked from commit d3481f5c2645fa96c710b4298c44ba915f7d9d92)

subject: Donot install policycoreutils-python for cs9
messages: [{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2021-12-02 15:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-12-06 07:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-12-08 21:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-02 15:58:19.000000000', 'message': 'Donot install policycoreutils-python for cs9

Since policycoreutils-python package is not available on
EL9 and bindep package is used in tripleo-ci
container-build role.

Since the package is not available so it breaks the EL9
container build.

Making it exception for EL9 fixes the issue.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5047980dc4f3a45316be047b4d7ba672297ab07b
(cherry picked from commit 51753617ff813238b74f7e7c263682d6ef65bc2d)
'}]
commit_message:
Donot install policycoreutils-python for cs9

Since policycoreutils-python package is not available on
EL9 and bindep package is used in tripleo-ci
container-build role.

Since the package is not available so it breaks the EL9
container build.

Making it exception for EL9 fixes the issue.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5047980dc4f3a45316be047b4d7ba672297ab07b
(cherry picked from commit 51753617ff813238b74f7e7c263682d6ef65bc2d)

subject: Improve docs for DNS HA
messages:
[{'account_id': 31515, 'date': '2020-01-17 13:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-01-17 13:17:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-02-13 23:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Corrections requested.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-12-09 03:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Change has not been updated to address feedback in > 180 days'}]

subject: Add Ceph Erasure Coding data pool option to cinder-ceph charm
messages:
[{'account_id': 6633, 'date': '2020-03-02 09:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-03-02 10:16:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi Marton

We need to bring this feature up a level to make it usable for deployments and transferable to other charms.

I think this needs to be modelled as a 'pool-type' configuration option (which defaults to replicated) with some additional pool ec configuration options for the K and M values that are required for setup.  There might be more than that - this spec needs to consider what a sensible set of opinionated defaults are and which ones need to be configuration options on each consuming charm.

Impact onto the broker interface for creating the pools also needs to be considered as I'm not sure that EC pools are something that is explicitly supported (but the backend code might be in the ceph-mon charm already)."}, {'account_id': 6633, 'date': '2020-03-02 10:48:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi James,

Would be great the have a fully supported EC implementation, in this case we just wanted to solve the problem of the external ceph cluster scenario, where the pools had been pre-created by the ceph cluster admins.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-03-10 16:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Being a spec I did not go over the text in detail but please use the format for section headers and code blocks as given in the style guide:

https://tinyurl.com/rksndyu

Let me know if do not have access (Google Doc).'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-12-09 03:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Change has not been updated to address feedback in > 180 days'}]

commit_message:
Add Ceph Erasure Coding data pool option to cinder-ceph charm

The Cinder Ceph should be support the default data pool setting in ceph.conf
for erasure coded pools, where both metadata and data pool must be used.

Change-Id: I43e9f2f5f9ea1842c12a9f6a11702a58389382ce
Related-Bug: #1863017

commit_message:
Add support for Arista ML2 Mechanism driver

Using the Arista ML2 mechanism driver, layer 2 (L2)
provisioning, such as creating and dynamically mapping
VLANs to physical switch interfaces can be automated.

Change-Id: Ie799c5bb033b1c4ebec2149f4456f47740fd20e5

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

(1 comment)

Thank you for your work on this plan.  Unfortunately, the comments and questions on the test topic is are yet addressed. To put it a bit more concretely:

Is the intention to place the new charm projects under option 1 or 2?:

1. https://opendev.org/x/charm-* (Unofficial, no functional tests in gate or in third-party-ci). With this approach, the charms would not be part of the OpenStack Charms release.

2. https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-* (Official project with functional tests in gate or in third-party-ci). With this approach, the ACI charms could be part of the official OpenStack Charms release.

Please advise. This is information is required in order to clarify the intent and the immediate path forward.

https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/feature-specification.html

https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/release-policy.html

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystemshttps://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/third_party.html'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-09-11 15:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Need to clarify the intended project status (namespace /x/ or /openstack/)'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-12-09 03:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Add neutron-aci-plugin spec

This specification document describes the changes to existing charms and
new charms required to support Neutron ACI plugin for OpenStack.

subject: User friendly message for non pristine disks
messages:
[{'account_id': 29799, 'date': '2019-04-30 12:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29799, 'date': '2019-04-30 12:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29799, 'date': '2019-04-30 13:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29799, 'date': '2019-04-30 15:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-05-24 11:29:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

While this is a more descriptive message for the user, the ceph-osd charm does, in fact, suggest useful next steps for the user: https://github.com/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/blob/c24c85312af7d6ba696f00af571d9769e0d3322c/hooks/ceph_hooks.py#L515

The correct action for an operator is to use the actions as indicated to identify disks that are having issues and resolve those issues with the zap-disk issue, rather than ssh'ing to the machine and running `sgdisk --zap-disk $problem_device`. Because we do have actions, and we do recommend those actions, I don't agree that we need a lot more details about what, specifically, led to us deciding that the disk is not a valid disk to use.

I'm open to being convinced otherwise, but the issue, and the resolution path, are stated reasonably clearly in the juju status output"}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-08-20 20:37:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm in favor of the added logging to add feedback in the UX of this.  I don't disagree with Chris's assessment, but ultimately this makes a condition more visible, which can be helpful in triage.

On the log message itself, please see my comment in-line.  One small change and I think we can run with this.

Thank you."}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-12-09 03:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Change has not been updated to address feedback in > 180 days'}]

commit_message:
User friendly message for non pristine disks

The first 2048 bytes must be all zeros.
But the user is not told why the charm is ignoring the disk.
The charm just that states that its not pristine.

This leaves the user with having to look through the
code and find this method, to determine why its ignoring the disk.

An additional log message here to help the user determine how to clear
the disk properly

Change-Id: Ifd70dd1fddb065b2689acf448426b65161467a03

subject: Add provides file
messages:
[{'account_id': 30373, 'date': '2019-05-09 07:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-09 07:41:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-05-29 07:15:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

One minor comment on the commit message AND I'm not quite sure I understand why the provides side of the interface needs to be implemented to support K8S - provides should be implemented in the non-reactive keystone charm?"}, {'account_id': 30373, 'date': '2019-05-29 07:25:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > One minor comment on the commit message AND I'm not quite sure I
 > understand why the provides side of the interface needs to be
 > implemented to support K8S - provides should be implemented in the
 > non-reactive keystone charm?

Hello James,

Thanks for the review. I will `git commit --amend` to fix the COMMITMSG.

Regarding the provides, when I use the current `keystone-admin` interface, when I'm building my k8s reactive charm, I get an error saying that `Unable to find implementation for relation: provides for keystone-admin`."}, {'account_id': 30373, 'date': '2019-05-29 07:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30373, 'date': '2019-05-29 07:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-08-20 20:27:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Re-iterating the question from James' review which hasn't been addressed:
This is on hold, pending clarity on the reason for this proposed change. 

Please raise a LP bug to define the feature gap or bug that this aims to address.  Thank you."}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-12-09 03:20:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Fixed check_ceph_status nagios plugin

- fixed comparing float with string (degraded_ratio and  misplaced_ratio).

- fixed checking recovery rate, we only do this when there's degraded
  or misplaced PGs.

- fixed to exit correctly on warning.

- fixed warning status when we're ignoring the nodeep-scrub flag

Change-Id: I05c9495953a8522761037b29f0e0ef52caa580ce

commit_message:
Gracefully handle empty volume group

If there's no volume in the volume group at all, then
it's safe to assume that non-existing volume is not
an active bluestore device.

Change-Id: Ia5c40b3f190e0fa1f55a279b849e26a581de8c15

commit_message:
[TEST] Test Ubuntu Fan Networking in UOSCI

At this point in time just a test to reveal which value
juju chooses for fan-config when run in UOSCI.

Will use this PR to add the LXD bundles back as gate bundles
as soon as we have the corrensponding ubuntu-fan configuration
set up on our test executors.

Change-Id: I40192c70c928074ec103e971dcdebfb85b4f0515

messages:
[{'account_id': 29938, 'date': '2019-02-15 05:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-15 05:57:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29938, 'date': '2019-03-18 10:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-03-25 15:39:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Check for apache pid on service restart

For openstack services fronted by apache WSGI, we need to check
for correct apache process restart in containerized environments
where there are more than one apache container

Closes-Bug: #1795918

Change-Id: Id3f3371cecd6755ddba3eaecd7db670758fa4433

commit_message:
Check for apache pid on service restart

For openstack services fronted by apache WSGI, we need to check
for correct apache process restart in containerized environments
where there are more than one apache container

Closes-Bug: #1795918

messages:
[{'account_id': 29356, 'date': '2019-01-16 13:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29356, 'date': '2019-01-16 13:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-03-05 10:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29356, 'date': '2019-03-21 09:45:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

In the time between me sending the git-review and the merge attempt to master by Zuul, this functionality appears completely offloaded to the charmhelpers.contrib.context module, where a class ApacheSSLContext exists. Although I haven't tested it personally, the charm-helpers code suggests this error does not exist anymore. Even if the bug lives on in charm-helpers, it should propably be fixed there and have the appropriate tests in there as well. Hence, I don't think it is relevant anymore for the master branch.

However, it is still appropriate for stable/18.11. Let me know which steps I should take to have it reviewed specifically for stable/18.11. Otherwise, I think we can close this review."}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-04-03 09:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2 Workflow-1

The change is not relevant after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638603/

The code in https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/blob/231ca88de85b63af01a5fc8557d90d365cf52f85/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py#L775 already allows you to specify ``ssl_cert`` and ``ssl_key`` without setting ``ssl_ca``.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-12-09 03:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning change due to obsolete'}]

commit_message:
Allow local SSL certificate and key without local CA.

Add support for local SSL certificate and key that are signed by a public
CA and do not require installation of a custom CA.

Change-Id: I154c03e91127c053f669cfc6b11c05c75b9774fa
Closes-Bug: #1811994

subject: Closes-Bug: 1812950
messages:
[{'account_id': 29799, 'date': '2019-02-04 15:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-02-12 12:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

According to the commit message policy (https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Information_in_commit_messages), the first line is the most important:

"In Git commits the first line of the commit message has special significance. It is used as email subject line, git annotate messages, gitk viewer annotations, merge commit messages and many more places where space is at a premium. As well as summarizing the change itself, it should take care to detail what part of the code is affected. eg if it affects the libvirt driver, mention 'libvirt' somewhere in the first line."

Given that, I'd expect this commit message to look more like:

"Use syslog for mysqld logs

Closes-Bug: #1812950"'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-12-09 03:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Change has not been updated to address feedback in > 180 days'}]

Signed-off-by: David O Neill <david.o.neill@canonical.com>
'}]

commit_message:
Disable cephadm when ceph is deployed

After ceph is deployed, which means day1 operations are over
and the Ceph cluster daemons are up && running, cephadm can
be paused by running the 'disable_cephadm' playbook.

Change-Id: I5952bb8a7a327e37a39acc95751cd5746fd9a41d

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Change-Id: Ie0c61d21b5a64210c79765dc3ebd3c39d4d98c5d

puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-28 13:23:41.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix default thin_provisioned volumes on AFF

The NetApp ONTAP driver was creating thin provisioned volumes on
AFF systems even when the thin provisioned extra spec was saying
the contrary.

ONTAP AFF systems create thin provisioned volumes by default, which
differs from FAS systems, that creates thick provisioned volumes by
default.

The NetApp ONTAP driver was modified to fix this misbehavior.

Change-Id: I9218bf0d7cb607dd75e892ce86af958d43a7fcdb
Depends-On: I44c2098d9b0858173bc9186246f4d573b19f43aa
Closes-Bug: #1929421
'}, {'created': '2021-11-10 14:10:25.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix default thin_provisioned volumes on AFF

The NetApp ONTAP driver was creating thin provisioned volumes on
AFF systems even when the thin provisioned extra spec was saying
the contrary.

ONTAP AFF systems create thin provisioned volumes by default, which
differs from FAS systems, that creates thick provisioned volumes by
default.

The NetApp ONTAP driver was modified to fix this misbehavior.

Change-Id: I9218bf0d7cb607dd75e892ce86af958d43a7fcdb
Closes-Bug: #1929421
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix default thin_provisioned volumes on AFF

The NetApp ONTAP driver was creating thin provisioned volumes on
AFF systems even when the thin provisioned extra spec was saying
the contrary.

ONTAP AFF systems create thin provisioned volumes by default, which
differs from FAS systems, that creates thick provisioned volumes by
default.

The NetApp ONTAP driver was modified to fix this misbehavior.

Change-Id: I9218bf0d7cb607dd75e892ce86af958d43a7fcdb
Closes-Bug: #1929421

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Dependencies defined in neutron::wsgi::apache are removed and loosen
to avoid direct deference to resources from puppetlabs-apache. When
httpd is used to run neutron-api, the neutron-service tag is added to
the httpd service, so that it is started during service phase.

Change-Id: I1a17a5ac990dd8e0a166b7d78b8a58a4b1055502

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Change-Id: I179fa93a0226f982019f2366684aa24b4e6e9a12
(cherry picked from commit 6d825ca6fe925f535504f34626f82116cdc49dd4)
(cherry picked from commit 89a24c2001f45e3a270f3247040bc352ee148faa)

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The server class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Change-Id: I7f2f5dbb7f7e07be611da61905201d90baee28ef

adds explicit definition of these parameters to use consistent path.

'}, {'created': '2021-12-07 13:14:09.000000000', 'message': "Re-run repo-setup in image/container run plays after pre mirror setup

In RDO jobs the mirror-info-fork is included after the repo-setup
role. This means we don't have NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR available
in /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh and we use mirror.stream.centos.org
which is proving unreliable eg 404 for 9-stream/AppStream [1].

This patch re-runs the repo-setup role in the run plays for
containers and image builds. The mirror-info-fork is run in pre so
this way NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR is available when we do repo-setup
e.g. mirror used at [2]

[1] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/67/36267/36/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-build-containers-centos-9-push-master/575a6f3/logs/container-builds/c9967fc5-5f3b-4c06-b93b-eff2cd775c84/base/os/manila-base/manila-base-build.log
[2] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/17/36817/13/check/periodic-tripleo-centos-9-buildimage-overcloud-hardened-uefi-full-master/d4e06e9/yum.repos.d/quickstart-centos-appstreams.repo

"}, {'created': '2021-12-08 09:16:40.000000000', 'message': "Re-run repo-setup in image/container run plays after pre mirror setup

In RDO jobs the mirror-info-fork is included after the repo-setup
role. This means we don't have NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR available
in /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh and we use mirror.stream.centos.org
which is proving unreliable eg 404 for 9-stream/AppStream [1].

This patch re-runs the repo-setup role in the run plays for
containers and image builds. The mirror-info-fork is run in pre so
this way NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR is available when we do repo-setup
e.g. mirror used at [2]

[1] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/67/36267/36/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-build-containers-centos-9-push-master/575a6f3/logs/container-builds/c9967fc5-5f3b-4c06-b93b-eff2cd775c84/base/os/manila-base/manila-base-build.log

commit_message:
Re-run repo-setup in image/container run plays after pre mirror setup

In RDO jobs the mirror-info-fork is included after the repo-setup
role. This means we don't have NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR available
in /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh and we use mirror.stream.centos.org
which is proving unreliable eg 404 for 9-stream/AppStream [1].

This patch re-runs the repo-setup role in the run plays for
containers and image builds. The mirror-info-fork is run in pre so
this way NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR is available when we do repo-setup
e.g. mirror used at [2]

[1] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/67/36267/36/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-build-containers-centos-9-push-master/575a6f3/logs/container-builds/c9967fc5-5f3b-4c06-b93b-eff2cd775c84/base/os/manila-base/manila-base-build.log
[2] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/17/36817/13/check/periodic-tripleo-centos-9-buildimage-overcloud-hardened-uefi-full-master/d4e06e9/yum.repos.d/quickstart-centos-appstreams.repo

Co-Authored-By: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibb5617c84b7a31a320aebecc82d980ba8e9751b6

commit_message:
early return for _share_replica_update() if there is no active replica

If the parent share of the replica has no active replica,
this is an error situation where _share_replica_update() simply
returns and logs a warning if the replica being acted on has not
been already in error state itself before.

Change-Id: I9bdbbaafba413fa4b2a783130fd58a4b6c2cea4b
Partial-Bug: #1924230

[{'created': '2021-12-08 14:06:22.000000000', 'message': "Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Dependencies defined in mistral::wsgi::apache are removed and loosen
to avoid direct deference to resources from puppetlabs-apache. When
httpd is used to run mistral-api, the mistral-service tag is added to
the httpd service, so that it is started during service phase.

Change-Id: Ia6edb3f8ceefa4d2480c33aee7893d7f43166eb9
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Dependencies defined in mistral::wsgi::apache are removed and loosen
to avoid direct deference to resources from puppetlabs-apache. When
httpd is used to run mistral-api, the mistral-service tag is added to
the httpd service, so that it is started during service phase.

Change-Id: Ia6edb3f8ceefa4d2480c33aee7893d7f43166eb9

commit_message:
Remove redundant default for [DEFAULT] control_exchange

The current default value of cinder::control_exchange equals to
the default value of [DEFAULT] control_exchange. This change makes
the service default used instead of redundant one hard-coded in
puppet layer.

Co-Authoered-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifd86d3ee30079d310269e7a954719246ec0dcdfd

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-02 01:14:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix name of iPXE efi bootrom

In change Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b
the file in tftproot was renamed from ipxe.efi to
snponly.efi. Later in the filename was parameterized
in change I565e3ae6388812c358e86fac49b17e0cce97b9df.

The dnsmasq DHCP configuration was not updated to
point to use the new filename, nor the parameter.

This change adds 'uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name' to
ironic::pxe::common, updates the other manifests to
use ironic::pxe::common::uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name if
set.

Also add the 'uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name' parameter to
the ironic::inspector class and update the dnsmasq
DHCP tempalte to use the parameter.

Backport note:
In stable/wallaby and older, the default uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name is
ipxe.efi(this was updated during Xena cycle), so the inconsistent usage
doesn't happen by default. However support for customizing
uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name is incomplete and it is fixed by this change.

Conflicts:
	manifests/inspector.pp

Resolved conflict caused by c7966378a036a58018ec0c1155ee6b58f52a49ca

Closes-Bug: #1952652
Change-Id: I1b3ccd8ad8f3ce66c66c58b1dfdca158d749c287
(cherry picked from commit 51ea0c95eabe8dd15493dd719b8ee34079ef3bb1)
(cherry picked from commit 2688458cb0eae1b09c50417477a27a8e8dba682b)

commit_message:
Fix name of iPXE efi bootrom

In change Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b
the file in tftproot was renamed from ipxe.efi to
snponly.efi. Later in the filename was parameterized
in change I565e3ae6388812c358e86fac49b17e0cce97b9df.

The dnsmasq DHCP configuration was not updated to
point to use the new filename, nor the parameter.

This change adds 'uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name' to
ironic::pxe::common, updates the other manifests to
use ironic::pxe::common::uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name if
set.

Also add the 'uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name' parameter to
the ironic::inspector class and update the dnsmasq
DHCP tempalte to use the parameter.

Backport note:
In stable/wallaby and older, the default uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name is
ipxe.efi(this was updated during Xena cycle), so the inconsistent usage
doesn't happen by default. However support for customizing
uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name is incomplete and it is fixed by this change.

Conflicts:
	manifests/inspector.pp

Resolved conflict caused by c7966378a036a58018ec0c1155ee6b58f52a49ca

Closes-Bug: #1952652
Change-Id: I1b3ccd8ad8f3ce66c66c58b1dfdca158d749c287
(cherry picked from commit 51ea0c95eabe8dd15493dd719b8ee34079ef3bb1)
(cherry picked from commit 2688458cb0eae1b09c50417477a27a8e8dba682b)

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Change-Id: I3b7d44f4de42595817f3c52a4f5e6892baaac187

commit_message:
Remove redundant default for [DEFAULT] control_exchange

The current default value of manila::control_exchange equals to
the default value of [DEFAULT] control_exchange. This change makes
the service default used instead of redundant one hard-coded in
puppet layer.

Co-Authoered-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idab8f85be97b0b3caceda9cbc93b0c4f8b23a7b7

messages: [{'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-03-01 10:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-03-01 11:20:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nIt looks like the unit tests for this charm were perhaps intentionally disabled?  The py36 environment isn't run by default, and py35 is simply redirected to /bin/true."}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-03-01 13:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 10:45:19.000000000', 'message': 'Added tox environment for gathering coverage

This technique was borrowed from the tox "cover" environment in
openstack/nova's tox.ini.  This leverages the fact that stestr lets
you override the python executable via the PYTHON environment
variable.  Doing this allows us to easily generate coverage for our
unit tests.

An important caveat is that this does not provide any coverage for
tests via zaza, amulet, etc.  It is purely focused on the unit tests.

Note that this replaces the previous .coveragerc; coverage
configuration is instead pulled from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I7914c3de3cc391f9722156edb838efbb40cef269
'}, {'created': '2019-03-01 13:40:08.000000000', 'message': 'Added tox environment for gathering coverage

This technique was borrowed from the tox "cover" environment in
openstack/nova's tox.ini.  This leverages the fact that stestr lets
you override the python executable via the PYTHON environment
variable.  Doing this allows us to easily generate coverage for our
unit tests.

An important caveat is that this does not provide any coverage for
tests via zaza, amulet, etc.  It is purely focused on the unit tests.

Note that this replaces the previous .coveragerc; coverage
configuration is instead pulled from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I7914c3de3cc391f9722156edb838efbb40cef269
'}]
commit_message:
Added tox environment for gathering coverage

This technique was borrowed from the tox "cover" environment in
openstack/nova's tox.ini.  This leverages the fact that stestr lets
you override the python executable via the PYTHON environment
variable.  Doing this allows us to easily generate coverage for our
unit tests.

An important caveat is that this does not provide any coverage for
tests via zaza, amulet, etc.  It is purely focused on the unit tests.

Note that this replaces the previous .coveragerc; coverage
configuration is instead pulled from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I7914c3de3cc391f9722156edb838efbb40cef269

subject: pci-passthrough-whitelist: allow devname regexps
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-21 12:27:19.000000000', 'message': 'pci-passthrough-whitelist: allow devname regexps

devname may vary depending on physical slots network adapters have been
added to. This patch allows to pass a regular expression to find the
proper device name (ie. "enp(131|216)s0f1").

Any other regular expression special character is also allowed (ie. $,
\b, ^, etc.)

Change-Id: Ic87d53f23516013b4b96c5841e385a7747e149b3
Closes-Bug: 1786283
Signed-off-by: Alvaro Uria <alvaro.uria@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
pci-passthrough-whitelist: allow devname regexps

devname may vary depending on physical slots network adapters have been
added to. This patch allows to pass a regular expression to find the
proper device name (ie. "enp(131|216)s0f1").

Any other regular expression special character is also allowed (ie. $,
\b, ^, etc.)

Change-Id: Ic87d53f23516013b4b96c5841e385a7747e149b3
Closes-Bug: 1786283
Signed-off-by: Alvaro Uria <alvaro.uria@canonical.com>

Fix ignored unit tests

Unit test files should be named like *_spec.rb otherwise these are
ignored.

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Change-Id: I2dad56c1d3fdeca153df9a18c7ef4174b3a20848
(cherry picked from commit ecce4a20fdcb534014b688efd6a13d6d03cb7a24)

commit_message:
Add /builds to the charm-build directory

The default for charm-build changed, which means the the CI looks in the
wrong place to find the built charm to upload it to the charm-store.
this patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I139719668742931dac2d27d4210c673e493a1ece
